TEXT_TOOLTIP_QUAFFUG,Quaffug was a Hutt who lived an extravagant life funded by a Ceramo-Werx complex until he lost it to Lando Calrissian is a sabacc match. Quaffug rebuilt his enterprises by exploiting the Jokhalli of Blimph's third moon, but never forgave Calrissian and attempted to execute the gambler during a Rebel negotiation. Calrissian gained the upper hand and saved Quaffug's life from the Jokhalli in exchange for a position in the Hutt Guardsmens' Guild.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_QUEUE_GROUND,Land production queue
TEXT_TOOLTIP_QUEUE_SPACE,Space production queue
TEXT_TOOLTIP_QUICK_REF,Planet Quick Reference
TEXT_TOOLTIP_QUINCE,'Big Quince' was a Sludir slave lord raiding and selling in the Outer Rim, brother to the infamous shadowport operator Omze. He rose to fame in the gladiator pits of Loovira and carried his old force pike as a reminder of his origins and a weapon against troublesome slaves and buyers. Quintik prided himself in his business, arranging his deals in person and willing to offer every courtesy and bribe to officials and powerful customers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_QUIST,Quist enlisted in the Republic military with his friend Adar Tallon but soon found a more lucrative career as a pirate. He presents a courteous and elegant front, but is always looking out for himself. Beneath the folds of his elaborate cape, his right arm ends in a knife blade that he is always ready to use.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_R22_SPEARHEAD,Inspired by the Aurek, the Tammuz-An designed the Spearhead as a hyperspace capable escort fighter. The Spearhead would prove to be a reliable and long serving hyperspace escort fighter for the Galactic Republic and then later widely used by the Rebellion whose pilots liked to heavily tinker with its design. This modability would see the Spearhead serve not only as a fighter craft but also as a Rebellion experimental test bed. The Spearhead would later receive a wide ranging upgrade program under the oversight of Dodonna and Blissex which would develop into the famous A-wing Interceptor.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAANA_TEY,Raana Tey was a Togruta female and one of the five Jedi Masters implicated in the Padawan Massacre of Taris. Tey maintained a reputation among the Jedi Order as being intense and untamed due to her individualism in combat, in no small part caused by her Togruta background. However, Tey was a victim of nightmares and headaches as a result of her natural Force sensitivity. Only after coming under the tutelage of Jedi Master Krynda Draay was she able to cope with these terrors.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAANA_TEY_HEALTH,Health: 185 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAANA_TEY_MOVE,Speed: 1.35
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAANA_TEY_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.2s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAHM_KOTA,Rahm Kota was a Jedi Master who often questioned the Council's decisions and advocated for greater force in their duties. When the Clone Wars began, Kota proved to be a brilliant commander and led several Republic offensives in the Outer Rim. Mistrustful of clone soldiers' abilities, Kota recruited his own personal militia, which saved his life when Order 66 was issued. Kota and his militia would form the nucleus of a rebel cell which would help in the formation of the wider Alliance to Restore the Republic.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAHM_KOTA_HEALTH,Health: 200 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAHM_KOTA_MOVE,Speed: 1.45 
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAHM_KOTA_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.2s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RAINA_QUILL,Before the Clone Wars, she had completed her medical training in hopes of becoming a doctor, but her planet soon was part of the Separatist cause. She joined this cause not for the greed and corruption that its leaders stood for but because she felt that Acherin had the right to secede, no matter what the intentions were. Raina was also worried that the Republic's rule was gradually becoming too absolute. Along with Toma, Raina became one of its top commanders and was a skilled pilot in battle.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_RANCOR,Rancors were large carnivorous reptomammals native to the planet of Dathomir. They were usually born brown, but in special circumstances, such as the mutant rancor, jungle rancor, and the bull rancor, their color may have differed. Although found on other worlds such as Lehon—where they were brought by crashed starships—Ottethan, Carida, Corulag, and Felucia, those from Dathomir were said to be stronger and more intelligent than others.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_RECUSANT,A fragile light destroyer originally built to act as a raiding vessel by the Commerce Guild and later sold off into other groups. While not the most durable ships, they are capable of outputting significant damage from a long range and carry a significant antifighter array to protect from strikecraft attempting reprisal.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RECUSANT_DREADNOUGHT,A rare, up-sized version of a Recusant used as a flagship or planetary assault platform. While larger than its counterpart, it is still comparatively fragile, but it is equipped with even more weaponry for long-range support.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_REP_NAVYTROOPER,Like other Republic forces, an amalgamation of varied local naval infantry and newer non-clone recruits make up a large portion of wartime forces. Naval Troopers are used for fleet and installation security and second-line forces, relying primarily on numbers when in open combat. Aside from further gear standardization under the Galactic Empire, these formations will not see much in the way of changes.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_REP_SKIPRAY,An early planetary defense Skipray model intended to replace the pre-Clone Wars Turbostorm gunship using systems tested on Toscan Q fighters. It is still a powerful assault craft but slower and not as well armed compared to later Imperial models.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_REPUBLIC_BOMBER,A dedicated assault craft used by the Republic Navy, the Republic Bomber is a mid-range bomber by the standards of its time. Its capable loadout can cause great damage to frigate and capital sized vessels, but it suffers under dedicated pressure from hostile starfighters, making escorts recommended.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REPUBLIC_HEAVY_BOMBER,Deployed as a heavy bombing platform compared to its lighter sibling, this bomber design is an unusual space combatant for the era. Focussing primarily on strikes against larger capital vessels, it can cause surprising damage when escorted to the target.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REPUBLIC_HEAVY_TROOPER,Veteran Republic infantry formations given heavier weapons and field armor for more dangerous operations. Used for actions like heavy urban fighting, putting down rogue governments and warlords, and backing up Jedi for peacekeeping missions turned actual battle. Become less common as Special Tactics Troopers and later clone infantry are introduced. Effective against all but the heaviest unit types.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_REPUBLIC_TIE,The first general production model in a famous line of fighters with roots in the Sienar Advanced Project Vessel. It was created to fill space aboard older warships but was pressed into greater service due to efficiency compared to more expensive Kuati interceptors. It is sturdier than its successor designs but less maneuverable.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REPUBLIC_TROOPER,Maintained regular infantry technically under republic-loyal local control to circumvent the Ruusan Regulations, used for peacekeeping and minor conflicts before the Clone Wars. Integrated wholesale into the GAR during the conflict and grown via conscription and volunteer soldiers, laying the groundwork for the Imperial Army. Less glamorous but far more numerous than clone infantry, equipped with common standardized gear to serve as often defensive, regular line infantry.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_REVAN,Revan was a Jedi of mysterious origin who learned from a plethora of masters. When the Mandalorian Wars broke out, Revan’s natural charisma convinced many Jedi to go against the Council's wishes and fight alongside the Republic military. Dudbed The Revanchist by the media, Revan and their followers helped turn the tide of the war, breaking the Mandalorian ranks at Malachor V and killing Mandalore The Ultimate, forcing the remainder to surrender or flee across the galaxy. Hailed as heroes, Revan and their loyalists then disappeared from the known galaxy, in search of a mysterious power in the Unknown Regions.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REVAN_HEALTH,Health: 240 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REVAN_KOTOR,Once the Dark Lord of the Sith, during a raid led by Jedi Bastila Shan Revan was betrayed by their apprentice Malak and severely injured. Bastila saved Revan's life and brought them to the Jedi enclave on Dantooine, where Bastila convinced the Council to erase Revan's memories in hopes of using them to stop the Sith. Revan's new persona was then enlisted in the Republic military, but a Sith attack led to Revan gathering a party on Taris to save Bastila. After escaping to Dantooine, Revan received Jedi training and unlocked their former Force potential. They were then sent on a journey to find the location of the Star Forge to stop the Sith.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REVAN_KOTOR_HEALTH,Health: 260 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REVAN_MOVE,Speed: 1.45
TEXT_TOOLTIP_REVAN_SITH,Once celebrated as the savior of the Republic, Revan and their followers vanished into the Unknown Regions after the final battle. Yet when Revan and their apprentice Malak resurfaced at the helm of an armada fueled by the ancient Star Forge, they declared themselves Sith Lords and established an empire bent on conquest. Darth Revan's Sith Empire declared war on the galaxy, rallying former allies, exiled Sith, and disgruntled Jedi under its banners. Over the next two years, the Sith onslaught under Revan's leadership would steadily batter down the Republic's defences.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_REX,One of the Clone officer units put through Alpha-17's Commander training. Rex is captain of the 501st Legion's distinguished Torrent Company and the most famous officer in the unit. Serves as a nominal second-in-command to Anakin Skywalker in field actions.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_RHYS_DALLOWS,A pilot in the Royal Naboo Security Forces Bravo Squadron who trained under ace pilot Essara Till. When his mentor was killed by a mercenary ambush funded by the Trade Federation, Rhys swore revenge, teaming up with Vana Sage and the Lok Revenants leader Nym in several strikes against the conglomerate. Rhys would rejoin Bravo Squadron in an assault on the invaders droid control ship, facing off against Essara's killer and triumphing in the ensuing battle. Dallows would be promoted to Captain and would lead Bravo Squadron through the Clone Wars, later becoming a sympathizer for the rebellion against the Galactic Empire.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RIBOGA,Riboga estalished himself as the crime lord in the Cularin system several decades before the outbreak of the Clone Wars, supervising a number of unsavory practices including a slaving ring and a spice mining operation on Kemix he built a huge warship to guard. He left due to the alleged unprofitability of the remote system, though in truth he was the victim of an embezzling majordomo who took over the operation and abolished the slave trade.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RINGNECK_RECON_DROID,The Ringneck recon droid, also known as the Separatist probe droid, was a model of probe droid manufactured by Arakyd Industries. It was used by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. It came in varying sizes, one of the most feared variants which protected the Separatist stronghold on Lola Sayu.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROHLAN_DYRE,A traditional Mandalorian Crusader, Rohlan Dyre's years of leadership made him a respected warrior. But he viewed the rise of the once ridiculed Neo-Crusaders and the rigid order imposed on Mandalorian society with suspicion as he campaigned in the Outer Rim. With his questions unanswered, Rohlan went to find his own before being captured and brought back into the fold. This kept on until the Mandalorians invaded the Republic, where Dyre met with the Jedi fugitive Zayne Carrick, who helped fake his death. Ironically Mandalore the Ultimate would twist this news into the legend of 'Rohlan the Questioner,' which proclaimed Mandalorians should never question authority.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROHLAN_DYRE_HEALTH,Health: 145 [1%/5s] (Hero)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROKON,Rokon was an admiral in the Galactic Republic's navy during the Jedi Civil War. He commanded the Champion of Iridonia, a Hammerhead-class cruiser. During a battle against Sith forces, Acaadi and his commandos infiltrated the Rokon's Hammerhead-class cruiser. During the assault Acaadi sabotaged the ships systems, causing an explosion that killed most of the bridge crew and left Rokon incapacitated.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROLAND_WANN,A Republic Officer who served as an ambassador to Manaan and the Selkath people. Wann requested the aid of Revan during the latter's journey to find the Star Map on Manaan, asking Revan to infiltrate the Sith embassy and discover the fate of a secret kolto harvesting station underwater.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROM_MOHC,An Army officer originally under the tutelage of General Locus Geen. When Mohc was defeated by General Grievous on the spike-stone plains of Mendig he developed an obsession with personal combat that would never stop affecting his career. This led to a keen understanding of cybernetic systems and battle droids as a result of his most commonly encountered opponents during the Clone Wars.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROMODI,Metalorn-born human who served with distinction in the Lambda Sector Defense Forces prior to the Clone Wars. Significant experience fighting against Aqualish rebels and Separatists gave him the experience to quickly rise as a Republic officer. Well-known for leading from the front aggressively regardless of his own safety.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_RONIKA_STATION,Infamous for its use over the Tetan slave world of Ronika whence it received its name, the Ronika-station is a capable orbital defensive platform. It is armed with a respectable array of weapons capable of keeping modest offensive out and starfighter bays to keep prisoners from escaping where it orbits. In contemporary times it is built to help maintain a defensive perimeter over important planets, as its original usage was easily transferred to standard military emplacements.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROOK_KAST,A member of Darth Maul's Mandalorian Super Commandos, Rook Kast would lead the mission to rescue the captured Maul from Darth Sidious' clutches. She then aided in Maul's plan to capture General Grievous, and led the Shadow Collective on Dathomir against the Separatist counterattack. The ensuing invasion was a failure for the Shadow Collective, forcing their Black Sun and Pyke allies to retreat in spite of Kast's rabid demands for them to fight a losing battle. Eventually she conceded the need to retreat, with her and Gar Saxon dragging away Maul to escape Dathomir.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ROOS_TARPALS,Roos Tarpals was a male Gungan who served as captain in the Gungan society of Otoh Gunga and one of the leaders in the Gungan Grand Army. In 32 BBY, he led an army of Gungans to pin down Trade Federation forces during the Battle of Naboo. During the Clone Wars, he was promoted to a general in the Gungan Grand Army, served during the Battle of Mon Cala, and ultimately gave his life to defend Naboo against Separatist forces led by General Grievous.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SABAOTH_BOMBER,Hefty but ponderous assault craft used by Sabaoth Squadron. Known for use of Trihexalon loadouts in terror attacks but loaded conventionally in typical combat, these heavy bombers carry an impressive array of munitions for attacks on larger vessels and installations. Reliant on escorts to protect themselves from other fighter craft.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SABAOTH_DEFENDER,A heavy assault fighter, the Sabaoth Defender was much stronger than the standard starfighters used by Sabaoth Squadron. In addition to denser armor and shielding, it was also equipped with additional lasers and powerful concussion missile launchers which made it a threatening strikecraft.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SABAOTH_DESTROYER,The iconic warship of Sabaoth Squadron, this skeletal destroyer is a testament to both the power of the mercenary group and the crumbling authority of the Galactic Republic where they operated. Decently rounded with anti-ship and anti-fighter weapons along with well-stocked hangers, it can function against most targets with success, but does get outmatched by more militarised ships in or above its weight class.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAI_SIRCU,Sai Sircu was a member of Yansu Grjak's Nightsister clan, who allied with the Separatists during the Clone Wars. Sircu harvested Force energy on Dathomir to help charge the crystals used to fuel the Devastation superweapon, hoping to use its power to subjugate the galaxy and extinguish the Jedi Order. When her Sith allies wished to test the Devastation on Dathomir however, Sircu usurped control of the ship and attempted to attack Coruscant with it.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SALLOW,Sallow Violect was an ex-Ailon Nova Guard turned bounty hunter. Abiding by her own code of honor in the trade, she would loudly challenge every target she had to a public showdown.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAN_HILL,San Hill was a male Muun and the Chairman of the InterGalactic Banking Clan before and during the time of the Clone Wars, who pledged the Clan's monetary and military assets to the Confederacy of Independent Systems. A typical member of his species, he was more at home in business, politics and intrigue than on the battlefield. He was one of the most influential politicians in the Confederacy; in particular he was responsible for the "creation" of General Grievous, the Confederacy's feared Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies. As the leader of one of the major supporters of the Confederacy, Hill was a member of the Separatist Council during the Clone Wars, and remained in that position until his assassination at the end of the war.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SANYA_TAGGE,Sanya was the Baroness of the House of Tagge in the leadup to the Clone Wars, of a noble house and a diversified megacorporation possessing a substantial private military. She made the unusual move of announcing her loyalty to the Republic during the uncertain times.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SARLACC,Sarlaccs were semi-sentient, plant-like, omnivorous creatures found on several planets across the galaxy. The Sarlaccs were unique among galactic species, having characteristics of both plant and animal, it spent most of its life underground with only its mouth visible from the surface. It lived to be tens of thousands of years old, and reproduced by spores.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SARLACC_HEALTH,Health: 700 (Infantry)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SARLACC_WEAP1,1x Animal Strike: 1 / 8.0s / 240m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SARNA,Sarna was a Sith junior officer who enlisted during the Jedi Civil War. Promised an exciting career serving in exotic locales, she found the reality of serving garrison duty on planets such as Taris below her expectations.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAUL_KARATH,Once one of the Republic's finest officers, Saul Karath's faith in it was broken by Darth Revan's return. Threatened by the loss of his command, Karath betrayed the Republic by bringing the Interdictor Leviathan and several other warships to Revan's forces. He would then be ordered by Darth Malak to bombard Telos to test his loyalty, killing millions as a result. When Revan was thought dead and Malak ascended as the Sith's leader, Karath would become the highest-ranking officer in Malak's service.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAUL_KARATH_PROMOTION,Promote Saul Karath to rank of Rear Admiral and grant him command of the Inexpugnable-class Courageous.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAUL_KARATH_REPUBLIC,Saul Karath was a Corellian who joined the Republic Navy as an escape from the chaos of the Great Sith Wars. Initially serving as a steward for naval hero Orley Vanicus, Karath grew into a talented pilot and tactician. While he faced numerous conflicts with bureaucracy, Karath would rebound to different positions before becoming the ranking officer fighting off the Mandalorians. His valor in the Mandalorian Wars earned him considerable prestige in spite of his numerous conflicts with the Jedi Order.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAUL_KARATH_RESPAWN,Swiftsure: Respawns in a Swiftsure-II if defeated
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SAUL_KARATH_UPGRADE,Upgrade: Inexpugnable
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCARAB,A heavier starfighter flown by an OOM or other pilot droid instead of being a droid itself. Developed shortly before the battle of Naboo to supplement Vulture droid squadrons, it is much more durable but at the cost of size and maneuverability.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCAV,Scavengers taking advantage of the current galactic conflict for profit. Often work with or subsume local governments and private armies. Well-equipped with pilfered gear and a threat to vehicles.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCHERP,Scherp is a Sith officer who rose up through underhanded politics and well-placed bribes. He lived a luxurious lifestyle in his position, purchasing a personal estate on Sernpidal and hiring private bodyguards. Scherp was entrusted with a code cylinder that held the command codes for the sensor systems of Darth Revan's flagship before Republic agents infiltrated his estate and extracted it from him. While Scherp maintains a confident demeanor, he had a cowardly persona underneath and was not willing to take risks when outnumbered.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCORCH,Scorch, designation RC-1262, was an elite clone commando who was part of Delta Squad during the Clone Wars. Scorch would receive his nickname in training from his love of explosives-and losing his and his trainers eyebrows for a time to them. This explosive passion made Scorch Delta Squad's demolitions expert, aiding the squad in breaking barricades or laying down high-ordinance on armored targets. A wise-cracker who held an undisguised love for his brothers, Scorch is the heart and soul of Delta Squad.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCREED_CW,A Human officer who started his career in the Judicial Forces and an early ally of then-senator Palpatine. He lost his left eye in the Biskaran Pirates' siege of Niele. In the Foerost Campaign Screed was given command of one of the two Victory Fleet task forces dispatched to deal with Dua Ningo's Bulwark Fleet. Following his victory and near death, he was promoted to Vice Admiral and given the Holt Cross alongside his friend Jan Dodonna.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCROPE,A Dashade ship-master who acted as Dallan Morvis' second in command. Scrope was in charge of Morvis' command skiff and the Phaedan militia present during the Battle of Essien. When he was captured by Mandalorians along with his commander and Zayne Carrick, Scrope would assist in the takeover of a Mandalorian dreadnaught in order to foil a plot to steal Jedi students from Dantooine. Afterwards he would continue to serve by Morvis.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCUPPA,Scuppa was a starship pilot under Jabba the Hutt, acting as an effective second in command aboard his yacht. Scuppa considered himself a friend of Jabba's, fighting alongside the Hutt for many years, though the sentiment was not fully returned by his boss.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCURRG_H6,Heavy bomber created by the Nubian Design Collective who hoped to sell the design to Outer Rim Planetary Defense Forces. Very well armed and capable, but with a large price tag that reduced popularity among legal interests. Such interests resulted in the common addition of the topside turret compared to the original design.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCURRG_H6_PROTOTYPE,Heavy bomber created by the Nubian Design Collective who hoped to sell the design to Outer Rim Planetary Defense Forces. Very well armed and capable, but with a large price tag that reduced popularity among legal interests. This closer-to-stock model lacks the extra turret popularized by secondhand production of the craft.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCYK_FIGHTER,Named after a vicious Tatooine reptile, the M3-A Scyk is the first in a series of custom starfighters commissioned by the Hutt Cartels from MandalMotors. It is a lightly armored interceptor that functions well for base defense and capital escort duties. The loadout of the fighter is customizable but generally limited to a single laser cannon, making it best used in short-range strikes.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SCYK_HEAVY_FIGHTER,The M3-A Scyk was a basic fighter produced by MandalMotors for semilegitimate organizations such as the Zann Consortium or the Hutt Cartels. The Scyk was just dangerous enough to be worthwhile without drawing the attention of MandalMotors Imperial supervisors, with its cheap price and variable weapon mounts making it popular on secondary markets even after production ceased. Heavier variants of the Scyk feature marginally improved durability and slugthrower cannons paired with a concussion missile launcher.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SD_5,Large, infantry-scale battle droid produced before the Clone Wars. An older design than the more successful SD-6 model and lacks some of the heavier weaponry and system improvements which make its successor so effective. Still well suited to engaging enemy infantry forces.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SD_5_COMPANY,Company: 8x SD-5 Hulk Infantry Droid

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SD_6,Large, infantry-scale battle droid produced in the final days of the Galactic Republic as an installation defense unit and fire support platform. A solid design that builds on several earlier generations and effective enough to see Republic service throughout the Clone Wars despite political outcry. The repeating blasters and Ion weaponry make it suited to engaging infantry, light vehicles and other battle droids.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SECUTOR,A massive carrier design that shares features with its Venator and Maelstrom predecessors. It is fast for its size, well-armed, and carries several times the fighter complement of most other capitals. It was designed late in the Clone Wars but only officially used by the Empire and its splinter factions. It is best used as a flagship for fleet groups seeking additional fighter superiority and firepower.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SELIMA,Sélima Kim was a pirate and starship mechanic who specialized in work for privateers. Once her son took over the business, he greatly expanded the scope of operations and named it in honor of his mother. The organization is focused on long term survival, and is paranoid about keeping the location of its main base secret.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SENATE_COMMANDO,Elite members of the Senate Guard, Senate Commandos served as bodyguards for VIPs and also as elite soldiers in the service of the Senate and Judicial Branch. In the field, they used much of the same equipment as Clone Troopers. Senate Commandos and Clone Commandos formed a rivalry during the Clone Wars due to overlaps in mission duties. By the end of the Clone Wars, the Senate Commandos were supplanted by the Red Guard and other services.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SENTEPTH_FINDOS,Sentepeth Findos served as a Separatist lieutenant during the siege of Cato Neimoidia. Findos later became Acting Viceroy of the Trade Federation immediately after the deaths of the Trade Federation leadership on Mustafar. Findos was forced to sign a treaty granting the new self-appointed Emperor Palpatine all of the Trade Federation's resources following the end of the Clone Wars.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SERISSU,Serissu was a Bothan pilot who owned a custom M3-A Scyk Fighter, who became a flight instructor by the time of the Galactic Civil War. At Tansarii Point Station she worked with the Car'das smugglers, training new prospective pilots for the group and giving them their own Scyk Fighters if they showed promise.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SERRA,Serra Keto was a Jedi Padawan whose defiant ways nearly saw her expelled from the Jedi Order on more than one occasion. Cin Drallig saw the potential she had and took Serra as his apprentice, forging a strong bond between the two. While Serra's rebellious streak subsided, she is still prone to restlessness both on missions and at the Jedi temple, and fought alongside Anakin Skywalker during the Clone Wars. While she lacks a Jedi Master's knowledge of the Force, Serra's skills at dueling approaches that of her master.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SERRA_HEALTH,Health: 200 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SERRA_MOVE,Speed: 1.25 
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SERRA_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.1s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SEV,RC-1207, nickname Sev, was an elite clone commando created along with his fellow brothers in Delta Squad to serve in the Clone Wars. Sev was the most dedicated of the Deltas in their initial training on Kamino, not wanting to disappoint their trainer Walon Vau, and often collapsed in his bunker from exhaustion at the end of the day. Serving as the squad's sniper, Sev has a notably darker sense of humor and demeanor than his fellow commandos, along with a rabid hatred of the Geonosians and Trandoshans that stood in their way. He would sometimes talk in his sleep on subjects disturbing enough to keep fellow commando Scorch up and uneasy.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SEVRANCE,Sev'rance Tann was a Force-sensitive Chiss soldier who gained the trust of Count Dooku and became an important Separatist commander. Ruthless and arrogant, she was infamous for her training of the Yresilini as a Chiss Cadet.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SEVRANCE_HEALTH,Health: 150 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SEVRANCE_MOVE,Speed: 1.3
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SEVRANCE_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.2s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHAADLAR_BASILISKAN,The Shaadlar, named from the Mando'a word for 'move', is an ancient design pilfered from the conquered Basilisk species. The Shaadlar's organic look shocks the unsuspecting worlds it descends upon, a trait the Mandalorians are eager to exploit. It serves primarily as a troop transport while also acting as a support vessel for orbital engagements. Its heavy armaments include ion cannons, a common theme in Basiliskan technology, as well as a a concussion missile battery usable against surface and space targets.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHAADLAR_BASILISKAN_HULL,Hull: 660 (Corvette)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHAADLAR_MANDALORIAN,A later generation Mandalorian-designed version of the Shaadlar troop carrier, shedding the original's Basiliskan roots by moving away from its insectoid aesthetic to a more utilitarian design. Marginal improvements across the board are made with it from better hull durability, shield strength, and speed. This Shaadlar retains a focus on ion weaponry while trading the concussion missile launcher for more prominent turbolaser batteries.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHEA_HUBLIN,Shea Hublin was a distinguished fighter pilot who joined the Republic navy at sixteen. He participated in the Western Reaches Operation, famously bringing down the shield of a Separatist holdout, and was named air marshal of the Greater Seswenna following the campaigns end. During the Galactic Civil War, Hublin reluctantly sided with Sander Delvardus when the Empire fragmented.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHONN,A Force adept with history as a sniper, engineer, navigator and starship captain. Hidden as a child by her parents out of fear the Jedi would take her away, the individual deaths of every family member in unrelated Republic actions cemented her loyalty to the CIS.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHU_MAI,A Gossam from Castell, Shu Mai was the Presidente of the Commerce Guild. She was extremely loyal to the Guild, and rose rapidly through its ranks due to her hard work and ability to make money. She would join the Confederacy of Independent Systems in pursuit of profit despite her doubts. Mai was an active leader of the CIS, helping the creation of the Shadowfeed to bombard the Republic’s civilians with propaganda, along with launching a Trihexalon attack on Coruscant.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHU_MAI_UPGRADE,Upgrade: Subjugator Heavy Cruiser
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SHUKALAR_FRIGATE,A somewhat sluggish warship of Althiri design, pressed into service as the Mandalorian Wars escalated and they proved useful as screening vessels.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SION,The Lord of Pain, Darth Sion has fought as a Sith Marauder since the Great Sith War. When he first fell in battle, Sion would surprise himself when he rose again; the dark side tethered his body together, granting him immortality at the cost of constant agony. He persisted through the Sith's collapse after the Jedi Civil War and caught the eye of Darth Traya, who took him as an apprentice. Despite learning much, Sion became disgusted with Traya's words haunting him. Conspiring with fellow apprentice Nihilus, the two stripped Traya of her power and exiled her. Sion would go on to hunt the remaining Jedi, dying countless times but constantly rising again.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SION_ACOLYTE_HEALTH,Health: 200 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SION_APPRENTICE_HEALTH,Health: 240 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SION_MASTER_HEALTH,Health: 280 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SION_MOVE,Speed: 1.25
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SION_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.2s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SIQO_VASS,A quiet, regal Kel Dorin, Siqo Vass was the captain of the famous Gozanti Cruiser, Krayt's Honor. Publicly his lieutenant Layn Wynest captained the ship due to growing pro-human sentiment from the Core. Vass frequently protected independent merchants, often posing as a common cargo craft to lure in raiders secretly sponsored by the Trade Federation to destroy them. Prior to the Clone Wars, Vass defended Jabba the Hutt's yacht from an attack, earning him Jabba's patronage and ensuring Krayt's Honor could always find a safe harbor on Tatooine.

They are armed with the most specialized weaponry in the Sith arsenal along with advanced personal shields, making them an effective deterrent against hostile incursions or as a mobile strike force.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_ASSASSIN,Masters of subterfuge, Sith Assassins work unseen on the battlefield until they sense weakness, at which point they pounce on their enemy. Sith Assassins in Revan's Empire to the Sith Triumvirate used both lightsabers for elite members and a mix of quarterstaffs and blaster weaponry for lower ranks. They would be used by the Triumvirate to great effect to ruthlessly hunt down Jedi.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_BOMBER,A further development of Sith fighter designs that carries a dangerous load of ordnance in a fast attack package. Moderately more durable than the standard Sith Interceptor but still requires some escort against hostile starfighters.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_COMMANDO,Sith infantry given specialized training in sabotaging enemy infrastructure or guarding areas important to Sith interests. Usually sporting red or black colored armor to denote them from standard Sith troopers, these commandos are fitted with personal shields and armed with repeating blasters and long-range rifles.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_INTERCEPTOR,A synthesis of ancient Sith hull forms, Rakatan engines, and many other sources, these light fighters combine high speed and excellent maneuverability into a fragile but inexpensive package deployed in mass quantities.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_TROOPER,Infantry sporting sleek, faceless armor, these troopers serve as the foundation of the Sith Empire. Their ranks range from fresh conscripts to Republic turncoats, but as a whole they are committed to enforcing the will of the Sith with all the bloodletting that entails. Sith troopers are often distinguished by their armor-color variants, with silver being the most common among the basic infantry. Their loadout includes a hefty amount of blasters, with the ranking officers donning personal shields.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_WAR_BEHEMOTH,These large herd beasts were one of dozens of different creatures that were used to augment the battle legions of the Sith. They were notable for being amongst the most impressive of these animals and were massive creatures that were used to transport troops, carry heavy weapons and break through enemy fortifications.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SITH_WAR_MAMMOTH,A gruesome war droid, the Sith War Mammoth is a lumbering beast that towers over the battlefield. It shares many traits with its sibling creation in the Sith Slayer, such as two shoulder-mounted anti-infantry cannons and alchemically treated Sith-armor plating. Though comparatively its durability is weaker than the Slayers, it should by no means be underestimated lest one suffer the wrath of this nightmarish beast.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SKAKOAN_COMBAT_ENGINEER,Skakoan commandos that are tasked with missions of vital importance to the Techno Union, ranging from exfiltration of corporate VIPs to guarding research outposts. Unlike traditional life-support suits seen on Skakoans outside their homeworld, Combat Engineer's suits are loaded with a variety of armaments, including wrist-mounted guns and portable explosives. These Skakoans carry out their task with fatal efficacy, and are even willing to detonate their pressure suits from sudden decompression so long as they can complete their objective.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SKETTO,Skettos were medium-sized, blood-sucking flying reptiles that dwelled in the caverns of Tatooine. Only emerging at daybreak and twilight, they possessed many rods in their eyes to assist their vision in low-light conditions as they ate airborne insects. Though reptilian, they were warm-blooded and gave birth to a single offspring at a time.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SKIPRAY,A heavy gunboat sometimes counted as a capital ship in small navies, the Imperial GAT-12h and its successors are a more combat-oriented improvement over the Republic GAT-12g model which lacked the concussion missiles and had a tractor beam for utility. It is best used to attack enemy capital ships but can be turned onto fighters in a pinch due to its turreted lasers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SKIPRAY_ADVANCED,Heavier Skipray model best known for its increased munitions load over earlier designs. Has otherwise equal performance and durability to the 12H model. It is best used to attack enemy capital ships but can be turned onto fighters in a pinch due to its turreted lasers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SKIRMISH_ALT_RECRUITMENT,Alternative Recruitment Structure

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SLAGORTH,Slagorth is a high ranking Galderian, an enigmatic race of slavers from the mysterious fringes of space who have long plagued the galaxy. Their signature Space ARC cruisers are believed to be the creation of an unknown race the Galderians have conquered.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SMEBBA_DUNK,Smebba Dunk was a rich and influential Hutt who became the head of the Hutt Clan Council. He carefully managed Hutt relations with the larger powers of the galaxy, seeking a friendly position while maintaining Hutt rights.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SMUGGLER,Travels the galaxy undetected by hostile fleets and can be deployed on enemy systems to steal credits away.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SOLENOID,An armored droid with a similar appearance to Skakoan engineers, Solenoid served the Techno Union, a leading technology concern that was allied with the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. In about 21 BBY, a Separatist corvette that Solenoid had been assigned to was attacked in the Ando system by a Galactic Republic task force. The ship was crippled in the engagement and was subsequently boarded by a team of Republic-allied freelance agents, whom Solenoid would enter combat with.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SOLOMAHAL,A veteran Lutrillian in Republic forces. Solomahal was already a General by the time the Clone Wars began due to his previous service with distinction. Famous for liberating the Wode species and later coordinating the defeat of the Sun Guard’s 2nd Regiment. Later assigned to defend a secret base on Azure used as an out-of-the-way location for important electronic warfare projects including Talesan Fry’s Codebreaker project.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SORA_BULQ,Former Weequay Jedi Master who now serves as Dooku's head Dark Acolyte. Renowned among the Jedi for his skill with a lightsaber, he mastered every form of lightsaber combat known among them, becoming one of their greatest instructors and Weapon Masters. Bulq's assistance of Mace Windu with the Vapaad form influenced his studies with darkness, and eventually pushed him into Dooku's grasp.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SPAR,Clone Alpha-02 was a Alpha class Advanced Recon Commando who would inherit the memories of Jango Fett and go rogue before the start of the Clone Wars while adopting the name of Spar. During the war he would reform the Mandalorian Super Commandos, which would become the Protectors with Spar claiming the title of Mandalore the Resurrector. Siding with the Separatists, Spar's forces would be wiped out in an ambush while attempting to kidnap Senator Amidala and afterwards he took refuge with the Skirata Clan.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_STALWART,Developed shortly before the Mandalorian Wars by Rendili, the Stalwart presents a link in the design philosophy between the Hammerhead and Centurion class vessels. Lessons and developments such as the armoured wedge shape and more plentiful ion weaponry are included, making it a potent ship to ship platform against often larger Mandalorian craft.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_STAR_FORGE,The Star Forge is an enormous space-station and factory both, produced by the Rakatan Infinite Empire countless years ago to fuel its conquests. Its hull contains a network of automated machines and foundries designed to mass-produce weaponry, droids and starships. As a result of its creation and use the dark side is enmeshed within the Star Forge, making it akin to a living creature that could feed on its energy. After the Infinite Empire's fall the Star Forge passed briefly into the hands of the early Sith before Revan and Malek discovered it ages later, using it as the base to fuel their new Sith Empire.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_STAR_FORGE_DRYDOCK,Drydocks used to maintain and supply ships freshly produced by the Star Forge.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_STARBOLT,Corellian carrier design introduced before the Clone Wars, and popularized by mercenary and planetary defense forces as demand increased in wartime. Decently armed for its role, allowing it to support its complement in attacks on other capital vessels. Saw a decline in popularity during the Galactic Civil War.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_STARHAWK_SPEEDER,The Starhawk is the most popular speeder bike on the market due to its inexpensive and sturdy design that offers high performance for a civilian model. Armed conversions are often found in the hands of Hutts lackeys, common criminals, and occasionally even Imperial Scout troopers.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_STARK,Famous pirate and businessman who instigated the Stark Hyperspace War. Joined the Commerce Guild at the end of the conflict, fleeing and betraying his followers to the Trade Defense forces.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_STORM_FLEET_DESTROYER,Raiding freight vessels used to subjugate and loot neutral worlds produced under a Kuat Drive Yards clandestine contract. Their appearance as freighters with an expected amount of visual guns for wartime allowed them to escape suspicion when en-route to targets, where retractable secondary weapons would be unveiled. Effective against stations and medium craft at close range, but not the best against pure warships of a similar size.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUBJUGATOR,A powerful battleship based around a specific heavy weapon. It was designed during the Clone Wars and is one of the largest vessels to come out of CIS shipyards. It is able to threaten entire battle groups by itself. Vessels of this class are typically armed with broadside Ion Pulse cannons though other configurations exist. It is well suited to engaging the largest enemy capital ships.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUBO,A minor crime lord who reigned on the fringes of the Outer Rim, Subo was an art collector who considered himself a Hutt of refined tastes. He grew interested in the lost planet of Endelaan, believing something there could prolong his life indefinitely so that he could inherit his fellow Hutts holdings. Subo attempted to bribe the crew of the Spiral Dancer for information on it, but the ships crew would escape his clutches.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUN_GUARD,One of the most feared mercenary units in the galaxy, originally formed by Thyrsian special forces units revolting against the Echani Command, before being subverted into a Sith Cult over the centuries. They are geared towards heavy personal combat and are very effective at engaging other infantry, fortifications and light targets but do lack for heavy anti-vehicle capabilities like the Mandalorian infantry they rival and individually surpass.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TANK,Combination assault vehicle and missile artillery known for rather impressive durability. The aptly named "Super Tank" packs MTT thickness armor and an impressive shielding system into the frame of a heavy tank, at the cost of logistical strain and overburdened repulsorlifts. Can engage targets as an artillery piece from range or a frontline assault tank depending on the current tactical situation, being individually effective at both, but not to the degree of groups of more dedicated assets.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VI,An armed version of the obsolete Super Transport VI armed with makeshift concussion missile launchers attached via external modular pods. A light shield was also added to increase durability under fire. This  resulted in a vessel which was better than nothing in battle and could maybe fend off some minor pirate attacks but worse than any dedicated combat ship.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VI_CARGO,Considered severely out of date by the time of the Galactic Civil War, most of these old massive cargo ships had been replaced by newer models of the KDY Super Transport series by the time of the Battle of Endor. A handful persisted in use around the galaxy although mainly in the hands of pirates who used the large vessel as mobile staging grounds for their raids.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VI_HULL,Hull: 600 (Corvette)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VI_MISSILE,Super Transport VI hull loaded with torpedo stocks to serve as an often sacrificial missile boat for desperate battles or owners. Can output a respectable amount of damage but will not survive under fire.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VII,A KDY Super Transport VII Bulk Cruiser modified to be better protected against pirate raids. Laser emplacements along the hull were added to allow the transport to defend itself against fighter attacks while the addition of ion cannons allowed it to try to fend off larger attackers. Weak shielding was also added to the vessel to provide it some additional protection over its civilian grade hull.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VII_CARGO,Smaller than their predecessor, the KDY  Super Transport VII could still carry an impressive 2 million metric tons of cargo. To maximise cargo carrying capacity the base design was slow, unshielded, and unarmed making them extremely easy prey for pirates.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VII_CARGO_SHIELD,Shields: Unshielded
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VII_HULL,Hull: 650 (Corvette)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VII_INTERDICTOR,A version of the KDY Super Transport VII refitted with a single gravity well generator in its cavernous holds to create a makeshift interdictor. Such an expensive investment also warranted the addition of lasers for self defence so it was not entirely helpless.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_VII_MISSILE,Standard Super Transport VII loaded with assault missiles to serve as an emergency or cheap fire support platform. While hard-hitting at range it can not expect to survive the attention of even a small proper warship with much success.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI,Seeing the adhoc armed refits of the older Super Transport models in response to pirate raids, KDY created their own armed variant of the Super Transport XI. Quad laser cannons were dotted around the hull to provide all round protection from fighter attacks that were frequently a key element in pirate attacks. The token shields of the base cargo design were also heavily reinforced to allow the ship to withstand minor attacks. This redesign turned a once helpless ponderous giant into a nasty surprise for attackers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_CARGO,A giant KDY freighter capable of holding 25 million metric tons of cargo, a single Super Transport XI can take the place of hundreds of freighters. However this cargo capacity was obtained through the sacrifice of shields, weapons, and engine power. Thus this lumbering beast of a transport is suitable only for the safest routes or routes with sizable escorts. Records show that on occasion enterprising individuals have been witnessed refitting the Super Transport in unexpected ways.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_CARGO_SHIELD,Shields: Unshielded
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_HULL,Hull: 2345 (Frigate)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_MISSILE,Super Transport XI filled with a variety of munitions as a cheap, makeshift missile cruiser. While the size allows space for a respectable amount of firepower that can hurt even larger ships when unmolested, focus on the vessel by strikecraft or other cruisers will quickly result in its destruction.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_MISSILE_WEAP1,2x Assault Concussion Missiles: 7 / 3.0s / 7.2km
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_MISSILE_WEAP2,2x Proton Torpedoes: 2 / 5.0s / 5.2km
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SUPER_TRANSPORT_XI_MISSILE_WEAP3,4x Concussion Missiles: 1 / 5.0s / 4.2km

TEXT_TOOLTIP_SWIFTSURE,An advancement off the original concept vessel for the Inexpugnable-class, refitted following suggestions from Saul Karath by Rendili/Vanjervalis designers such as an advanced communications system. The Swiftsure-II compared to its origins would become a mass production model under the Republic Navy, acting as a smaller scale command vessel in areas its cousin design would be impractical to use. Featuring improved shielding and proton torpedoes compared to the original, the Swiftsure-II is a formidable vessel able to take on most threats of the era outside larger battlecruisers on its own.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SWIFTSURE_HULL,Hull: 4185 (Capital)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SWIFTSURE_MOVE,Speed: 4.2 | Accel: 0.1 | Turn: 0.4
TEXT_TOOLTIP_SWIFTSURE_PDF,Inspired by the archaic Audacious-class, the Swifsure-I is based off the small-scale concept design for the Inexpugnable-class from where it received its name. Its general deployment was extremely limited due to the Navy favoring a larger design for the Inexpugnable, leaving the Swiftsure a rare sight until refits saw it mass produced in greater numbers. While uncommon, the Swiftsure-I retains an armament befitting an intended command ship, and should not be underestimated.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_T19,Knockoff V-19 Torrents produced for sales to planetary defense forces during the Clone Wars. Retain decently high flight performance, since while not as effective as the base design the over-engineered Verpine roots keep even the diminished form comparable to other budget alternatives.

As Jedi and Twi'lek partisans were advancing on the planets capital of Lessu, TA-175 planned an evacuation on orders from Count Dooku. Tambor wished to plunder as much of the planets wealth to take with him as possible, but TA-175 left him behind due to how long he was dallying.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TAGOONTA,Tagoonta was a Shell Hutt who led a modest criminal network. After troubles arose in Hutt Space, he fled to the far side of the galaxy to a transfer station in the unassuming Murk system.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TALIA,A daughter of Onderon's Royal House, Talia would help negotiate Onderon's entrance into the Republic. After the Jedi Civil War her reign as Queen saw her committed to staying within it despite protests from her cousin General Vaklu. Talia's government would supply the Telos Restoration Project with wildlife to seed Telos' ruined landscape, with Talia herself taking the hidden Jedi Master Kavar as a personal advisor while Kavar hid from the Sith. Eventually civil war would break out between Talia and Vaklu's supporters, ending with Talia's victory and Onderon's continued membership in the Republic.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TALLON_CW,Celebrity-officer famous before the Clone Wars started thanks to authoring the Treatise on Starfighter Tactics, which heavily influenced the design of the Republic's T.I.E. Starfighter. Given command during the war he eventually became known as a "Father of the Republic Navy".

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TAMBOR,Wat Tambor was originally a corporate senator for the Techno Union, who grew disillusioned with the Republic after he failed to stop a damaging tax bill. Tambor rose to the head of the corporation and sought to fortify its position in the galaxy. Conspiring with Count Dooku and other corporate leaders, Tambor would pledge his droid armies to the Separatists while trying to maintain a veneer of neutrality initially. As a combat engineer he has superb technical skills, on top of surprising tactical prowess matched with extensive weaponry encased in his pressure suit.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TARKIN,Born on Eriadu to a powerful and militaristic family, Tarkin began his career in the Outland Regions Security Force before retiring into a sector governor. His ambition and support of Palpatine combined with his prior experience in the ORSF let him advance the ranks of the Republic Navy quickly despite his distaste of most Jedi.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TARNTA,Tarnta Bane created the Consolidations Unlimited group to run a variety of criminal operations, from slaving to piracy to smuggling. Unusually for a slaver, he has a perpetually cheery disposition, always cracking jokes, caring for his men, and cheerfully wishing his victims "better luck next time". He will also kill anyone who crosses him with the same glee, as many who have underestimated his charming personality have found.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TECTOR,The battle-oriented counterpart of the Imperator-class that shares the same base hull. It was developed alongside the ISD-1 during the Clone Wars but was never as popular among the Imperial Navy. Additional armor plating and structural reinforcement cover up the reactor dome and hangar bay which lends increased durability at the cost of a fighter escort. It is well suited to battling other large vessels but requires protection from bombers.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TELETTOH,Telettoh was a Republic naval officer who became the official liaison between the Navy and the Revanchist Jedi, and was a fan of Revan's leadership. He served as Captain of the Hammerhead-class Testament, but eventually Telettoh would be promoted to the rank of Admiral. His struggles managing Malak during the latter's time aboard created the informal rule known as Telettoh's Maxim among Republic spacers, which boldly suggested not to bring Sith Lords on ones vessel for fear of the risks involved.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TEMPEST_CRUISER,An unusual combat cruiser design secretly developed by a fringe Hutt. While durable and flexible, the overall firepower was considered weak when compared to purely military contemporaries. Capable of trading fire with most target types while contributing a respectable amount of smallcraft to the fight as a result of its impressive cargo space.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TEMPLE_SECURITY,Security forces tasked with keeping the Jedi Temple secure from threats ranging anywhere from eccentrics to armed incursions. Their ranks drew from non-Force-sensitives and former Jedi unable to pass their trials who still sought to serve the Order. Temple Security's history with the Jedi Order spanned thousands of years, before both were crushed together by Order 66. The reestablishment of the Jedi Order under Luke Skywalker prompted a renewed need for security for the New Jedi Order's temple, with a new Temple Security formed from civilian recruits.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TENDIR,Tendir Blue was an agent in service to the Techno Union. Shortly after the breakout of the Clone Wars Blue hunted down the runaway researcher Ratri Tane and the prototype droid files he stole on Corellia. He cornered the Jedi Aayla Secura and Ylenic It'kla with Tane, but in reality it turned out Tane was the Jedi Nejaa Halcyon who had secreted Tane away already. After being knocked unconscious briefly Blue was allowed to escape after a feint chase the Jedi set-up, unknowingly carrying sabotaged copies of Tane's work.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TEROCH,Teroch was a Mandalorian follower of chieftain Nam Beroya of Clan Awaud. The clan left Mandalore during the power struggle between the New Mandalorians and Death Watch to pursue work as apolitical mercenaries. Teroch with his clan worked jobs for both the Hutts and the Separatists during the Clone Wars. After a few years Teroch's clan settled on the Outer Rim world of Vlemoth Port, where they formed an allianced with freed Talz against Zygerrian slavers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TF_OUTPOST,A small station designed by the Trade Federation to maintain a presence over remote worlds or for when the TF needed to establish a presence rapidly. It is often used as a safe location to conduct trade deals by many different parties during peacetime. While diminutive, it is well armed and protected enough to fend off minor attacks and pirate raids.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TF1726,An early T-series Tactical Droid with masculine programming, TF-1726 is best known for their performance in the Battle of Quell, where he engaged several Venator Star Destroyers with a fleet of Munificents and won handily. TF-1726 carried a strong disregard for the safety of the droids under his command, treating them as assets rather than mechanical brethren that could be disposed of when convenient.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_THALASSIAN,The Thalassians are the oldest of the major slaving groups in the Outer Rim, alongside their bitter rivals the Zygerrians and Karazaks. They operate on a large scale, covertly supplying large mass labor for corporations and new colonies, or sourcing to unscupulous Hutts. Undisciplined, savage, and feared, Thalassian slaveships enjoy piracy and mercenary work and will have few cares if half their targets are killed, or if their prey consists of other pirates, smugglers, and sometimes other Thalassians. Their convoys most often consist of a Kaloth Battlecruisers and Y164 transports.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_THERBON_CW,Therbon was an individual who served the Galactic Empire shortly after the Declaration of a New Order. Therbon was made Grand Moff of the Maldrood Oversector and commander of the Twelfth Army of the Republic.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_THETA_SHUTTLE,Built by Cygnus Spaceworks, the Theta-class T-2c shuttle is the follow-up design on an older shuttle design.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TIE_BOMBER,A bomber armed with proton torpedoes. It replaces the unpopular TIE/gt model and is a significant improvement over that design. It is best used to attack the larger enemy ships and space stations along with bombing runs against ground targets.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TIE_FIGHTER,A speedy and maneuverable light fighter that became one of the most recognizable Imperial symbol after being chosen to standardize fighter models shortly after the Empire's founding. It is cheap and lacks shielding and adequate armor compared to other designs. It is best used en-masse to engage enemy fighters and bombers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TIE_POD,Spinoff design of the T.I.E. Starfighter line pushed into service during the last year of the Clone Wars. Overgunned but under-protected compared to the base design, the near-exclusive use of cloned pilots betrays their expendabiliy in the name of enemies killed.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TIE_STARFIGHTER,An upgrade of the Republic's T.I.E Starfighter, the TIE Starfighter was the first member of the TIE family designed in the Imperial era. The Empire needed vast numbers of fighters to occupy an entire galaxy, so the TIE Starfighter was quickly phased out in favor of the less capable and less expensive TIE/ln (better known as the TIE Fighter).
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TNT,Originally a mining vehicle designed for the spice mines of Kessel during the era of the Republic, the Treaded Neutron Torch was adapted into military usage during the collapse of the Galactic Empire as makeshift assault tanks. A hull designed to survive perilous mine shafts offers a surprising amount of protection in combat and torches capable of melting easily through rock are also capable of burning their way through lots of other material that might see use on a battlefield.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOBBA,A socialite of legendary excess, Tobba has been known to invite strangers down to visiting dockworkers to lavish parties aboard his ship. Banquets, shooting displays and more take place at these events, but the highlight is the Krayt dragons kept belowdecks being fed former business associates.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOBBI_DALA,One of the 212 members of the Mandalorian Super Commandos fighting for the CIS during the Clone Wars as part of the Mandalorian Protectors, Tobbi Dala was one of only three survivors of the Protectors by the end of the war. He and his lifelong friend Fenn Shysa, another survivor, would continue fighting against the Republic turned Empire when it occupied Mandalore. Dala would die during the Galactic Civil War when holding off the Empire’s troops to allow Princess Leia Organa and his friend Shysa to escape from the City of Bones.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOL_CRESSA,Tol Cressa was the Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic from the time of the Mandalorian Wars to the Dark Wars. His popularity was undisputed and managed to hold him in office for a long time. Cressa during the course of the Mandalorian Wars appointed Revan as Supreme Commander of the Republic's military due to their success at Duro and as a snub to the Jedi Council.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOLARIS_SHIM,Tolaris Shim was a Jedi Master and active member of the Jedi Order during the time of the Great Sith War. A contemporary of Ulic Qel-Droma, Master Shim firmly believed that all Jedi at some point step along the path of the dark side of the Force, and cautioned that the concepts of redemption and atonement cannot help control a journey on the dark path. Jedi who hurt innocents under the sway of the dark side Shim believed could not be redeemed, but only atone for their actions. To that end Shim acknowledged that all Jedi must not ignore the shadows and the routes that lead to them, while also not blinding themselves to the light and taking responsibility for their own powers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOLARIS_SHIM_HEALTH,Health: 180 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOLARIS_SHIM_MOVE,Speed: 1.1
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOLARIS_SHIM_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.2s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOMA,During the Clone Wars, Toma allied himself with the Separatists but worked with Senior Jedi General Garen Muln to negotiate a treaty. However, when Order 66 was executed the plans for a treaty were eliminated. Toma and the newly formed Acherin resistance helped the Jedi safely escape the planet to head for safety on Ilum. Toma led the resistance through the battle against the Galactic Empire for nearly a year, operating out of the ancient city of Eluthan.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TONITH,Muun from the planet Muunilinst who served as admiral of the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. A member of the Tonith family, he had originally been a financier before entering military service. A great believer in his own military genius, and his position as a "favored minion" of Count Dooku, although some of this may be marked with hubris.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TORANI_KULDA,A Rodian hunter and assassin from the Virulii Clan, Torani Kulda was regarded as a respected up-and-comer in Hutt Space. Torani frequently kept the company of Rodian lackeys along with the assassin droid A0-2, and flew a M12-L Kimogila Heavy Fighter while on the hunt.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TORBIN,The Information Director of the Judicial Department, Laddinare Torbin served as the spokesperson for concerns involving the Jedi Order. After Order 66 Torbin would be enlisted as a member of the new Empire's Inquisitorius, eventually rising to the rank of Grand Inquisitor.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TORBIN_HEALTH,Health: 200 (Hero)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TORRENT,A maneuverable mainline fighter, this craft was originally designed for the Clone Wars where it was one of the most common Republic fighter models. Imperial service saw it replaced by the TIE Series and relegated to the Outer Rim where it would begin to see use by other groups.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TORRENT_BLUE,Blue Squadron was a starfighter unit active under the Republic Navy. During the Clone Wars, several different flights operated under the call sign, one of the more prominent ones was the squadron led by clone pilot Axe who was assigned to the fleet of General Anakin Skywalker and his Padawan Ahsoka Tano.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOSCAN_BOMBER,Use of the Toscan Q-8 kit's available heavy weapon and internal capacity capabilities is capable of producing a bomber model inferior to the later Y-wings it resembles.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOSCAN_GUNSHIP,Variation of the Toscan platform used produced by Sienar to testbed systems for the Skipray blatboat that were not present on the more CAS-oriented Turbostorm forebearer. The up-gunned vessel with a large complement of weapons paired with the resilient frame results in a medium-heavy fighter dangerous beyond the design projections.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOSCAN_INTERCEPTOR,Pirate and privateer conversion of the Shobquix Toscan starfighter kit. Aggressively tuned power systems provide the base for modified engines and laser cannons that assist in running down targets compared to the stock model.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOSCAN_MISSILE,Open-frame starfighter kit designed by Shobquix Yards that initially floundered before becoming popular throughout the galaxy. While servicable in general performance the cost to produce legally was considered overly high. This common configuration includes a concussion missile launcher.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TOSCAN_STOCK,Open-frame starfighter kit designed by Shobquix Yards that initially floundered before becoming popular throughout the galaxy. While servicable in general performance the cost to produce legally was considered overly high.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TRACHTA,Male human officer who was severely injured while on a mission to capture a Jedi Padawan who was defecting to the CIS. TEXT_TOOLTIP_TRAYA,The Lord of Betrayal, Darth Traya was a former Jedi Master thought to have died in the Mandalorian Wars. In reality she discovered the ancient Trayus Academy on Malachor V from the trail of her former student Revan. Donning the mantle of Sith Lord, she used Trayus' assassins to begin a terror campaign against the Jedi known as the Dark Wars. Her apprentices Darth Sion and Nihilus would betray her though, overthrowing Traya. While her apprentices thought her dead, Traya instead survived and sought out an exile from the Jedi Order, who she took as her greatest apprentice.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TRENCH,A feared and legendary commander for the Andoan forces, Commerce Guild, and now Confederacy of Independent Systems who was presumed dead on several occasions only to re-appear later. He is a mastermind of blockades and counteroffensives and one of the Confederacy's most experienced officers. He is the nemesis of the Republic Admiral Yularen who has faced him on multiple occasions.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TRIFIGHTER,A compact, Colicoid designed droid fighter built around a reactor and advanced droid brain. It is fast, powerful, and agile but costly enough to not be deployed in as great numbers as vultures and their derivatives. It is very well suited to dogfighting and intercepting bombers.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TUUK,Mar Tuuk was a male Neimoidian captain in the Navy of the Confederacy of Independent Systems. He is a shrewd tactician noted for his study of military history and psychoanalysis of the Republican naval officers and Jedi he is often sent against. Unusually well connected to the Techno Union, and on speaking grounds with Emir Wat Tambor, who calls upon him for military and personal business.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_TWILIGHT,A Corellian G9-Rigger freighter originally owned by Hutt crime lord Ziro Desilijic Tiure, and used as a spice runner. Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker and his Padawan Ahsoka Tano commandeered this freighter to escape the Battle of Teth in order to return Jabba Desilijic Tiure’s son to Tatooine. Anakin, Obi-Wan, and Ahsoka continued to use and modify this ship until it was destroyed by Darth Maul and the Shadow Collective.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_TWIN_SUNS,A pair of Twi'leks from Ryloth, Seer'aa and Teer'aa were once slaves who killed their master. The two would partake in the crime lord Goto's hunt for the Jedi Exile during their visit to Nar Shaddaa in the Dark Wars. In battle both assassins wield Twi'lek Spinning Blades which they use to enact their beautiful dance of death on their targets.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_UTAA,Dedicated anti-air repulsorlift vehicle developed for the Clone Wars with the wave of other military vehicles. Has token self-defense guns to protect its battery of AA missiles. Eventually succeeded by the AT-AA Walker for general use, which was more resilient and versatile.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_UTAT,Repulsorlift assault vehicle created shortly into the Clone Wars for situations where walker vehicles are less-suited. Unwieldy and fragile compared to other heavy vehicles, but has a powerful set of fore-mounted anti-vehicle weapons. Standard configuration also boasts a respectable transport bay and rear-coverage anti-infantry guns.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_UTAT_COMPANY,Company: 1x UT-AT

TEXT_TOOLTIP_UTHAR_WYNN,The headmaster of the Sith Academy on Korriban, taking it over after overthrowing his master Jorak Uln and driving Uln into the Valley of the Dark Lords. Wynn would take on the Twi'lek Yuthura Ban as his apprentice, and the two would cultivate new initiates to the academy through a series of competitive tasks designed to root out the weak. Wynn had an extremely typical Sith mindset, believing the Force was meant to enhance and serve his own power and praising his students for committing brazen acts of the Dark Side.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_V_WING,An extremely fast interceptor with a respectable armament. Developed by Walex Blissex during the Clone Wars to be launched in swarms by mainline Republic carriers, it would later be phased out after a few years of Imperial service in favour of the more cost-effective TIE series. It is best used to engage enemy fighters or respond to incoming bombers.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_V_WING_BOMBER,Rare variant of the V-wing interceptor that adds bomber level armaments to its frame.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VAAT,The Variable Altitude Assault Transport/enforcement was a Rothana Heavy Engineering gunship transport design which predates the LAAT. It lacks the firepower of its successor design but provides a lot more protection to its occupants and is more resilient to incoming fire. It was seen in service in a range of local security forces including those based on Coruscant before the Clone Wars and would remain in service with law enforcement agencies even into the Galactic Civil War.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VAAT_COMPANY,Company: 1x VAAT/e

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VADER,The Dark Lord Darth Vader was once the Jedi Anakin Skywalker. When he was defeated by his former friend Obi-wan Kenobi, Vader was retrieved by Darth Sidious. His agonizing recovery had Vader encased in imposing life-support armor, and with it came the realization he had lost everything save for his new master. Now Vader acts as the notorious enforcer of the Galactic Empire, seeking to crush all who oppose it with his brutal strength and the power of the Dark Side.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VAKLU,Vaklu was an Onderonian general and commander-in-chief of Onderon's armed forces during the Mandalorian Wars, the Jedi Civil War, and the Dark Wars. During the Mandalorian Wars, Vaklu led the resistance movement against the Mandalorian occupiers. He was loved by many, and decorated as a war hero. He gained much support from within the ranks of the military and from the populace of Onderon to seize control of the throne of Onderon from his cousin, Queen Talia. This coup d'état soon erupted into a full scale civil war.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VALOR,The Valor is a large military starbase used by the Republic to defend planets of key importance. Its design incorporates a large suite of command and control facilities and three outrigger docking arms with 3 large hangars on each arm. The capable Valor is a central command and logistical hub for many military operations of the Republic. It is no surprise that such a critical station is bristling with weapon emplacements for its own defence from attack if such eventualities arise.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VALOR_HULL,Hull: 21000 (Capital)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VANDAR,The leading master of Dantooine's Jedi Council, Vandar Tokare excelled at reading portents that frequently proved correct. His prophecies ranged from a belief that the Jedi Exile would stay true to the light even after joining Revan, and a vision of the destruction the Order would face in the Jedi Civil War that was interpreted by the Council as a warning to not battle Mandalore the Ultimate. Tokare would reteach the amnesiac Darth Revan how to use Force when the latter was brought to Dantooine, and narrowly escaped Malak's bombardment of the planet before taking part in the assault on the Star Forge.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VANDAR_HEALTH,Health: 190 [2%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VANDAR_MOVE,Speed: 1.2
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VANDAR_WEAP1,1x Lightsaber: 1 / 0.1s / 1m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VANGAR,Vangar is a dreaded Barabel pirate lord based on Prexiar. His enemies are treated cruelly and failures and traitors among his own crew fare scarcely better against his short temper. For all his use in combat situations, Vangar is carefully managed by a group of "advisors" who ensure the subtler aspects of piracy are not hampered by their fearsome leader.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VARKO,Varko was a Sith Admiral who assumed the position of Darth Malak's second-in-command following the death of Saul Karath. He would oversee the Star Forge's production and defense during his tenure up to the Republic assault on it.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VAZUS,Human male from the planet Corulag. He was born during the waning years of the Galactic Republic, and by the time of the Clone Wars was in his middle ages. During the conflict Mandrake commanded a mercenary unit that had been hired by the Confederacy of Independent Systems, and he was sent to fight on the planet Felucia in the Outer Rim. However, during the battle Mandrake's unit was wiped out by Republic troops, and Mandrake fled into the Felucian jungle where he hid out the rest of the war.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VAZUS_HEALTH,Health: 175 (Hero)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VEELA_ORDO,Veela was a Mandalorian warrior and the wife of Canderous Ordo. The two would separate following the defeat against Revan's forces, with Canderous leaving to become a mercenary while Veela took over as head of Clan Ordo. As clan chief she attempted to find the missing mask of Mandalore on Rekkiad, fighting other clans who hoped to seize it and the mantle of leadership for themselves. Commanding from her own Basilisk war droid with fellow riders in battle, Veela led the clan for years, until a reunion with her husband and a disguised Revan set her on the path to the mask.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VEELA_ORDO_UPGRADE,Upgrade: Kyramud [Requires Tegris Ordo's death]
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VEILED_QUEEN,The Veiled Sorority is a secretive pirate group led by a Pirate Queen and an all-female advisory council. The Sorority remains almost unknown to the public and authorities due to limiting their targets to other criminal organizations which led to a costly confrontation with the Zann Consortium.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VEILED_QUEEN_SQUADRON,Fighters: 0.5 / 0
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VELRUGHA,Velrugha was a Hutt lord who led several invasions on Riileb. The planets sentient native species, also called the Riileb, were discovered previously by Nimbanese scouts who served the Hutts looking to find more slaves for their masters. The Riilebs resourcefulness repeatedly fought Velrugha back, who eventually gave up, looking for easier marks.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VENATOR,An iconic carrier-destroyer hybrid. The Republic-designed Star Destroyer was introduced early in the Clone Wars with a large hangar and notable dual-bridge towers. It relies heavily on its fighter complement and is intended to be supported by other vessels such as its counterpart, the Victory-I. It is decently well rounded in spite of its focus on fighter tactics but best not used against larger ships.

Availability spikes as Clone Wars surplus is sold to local forces and groups or picked up at mothballs. Consists mostly of weapon modifications intended to aid in support of other capital ships and for piracy operations. Has a hard time killing other capital-scale vessels on its own.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VENATOR_TRANQUILITY,The Tranquility was a Venator-class Star Destroyer within the Open Circle Fleet that served as the flagship of Jedi General Luminara. The ship housed a highly secure detention level with several cells, each fitted with ray shields capable of withstanding several blaster shots and even lightsabers. Following the capture of Separatist Leader Viceroy Nute Gunray, the Tranquility was tasked with transporting him from Rodia to Coruscant where he would stand trial for his crimes against the Republic.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VICTORY1,A venerable heavy cruiser, the Republic-designed Star Destroyer is meant to complement the Venator-class by focusing on ship-to-ship combat and system defense. It has a powerful battery of missiles for firepower but is hindered by an archaic drive system. It is best used to deal damage to enemy ships with its missile payload and large gun array.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VICTORY1_ALT,One of the many refits of the Victory-I Star Destroyer, this variant features longer-barreled turbolasers that replace some of the existing turbos, giving the Victor-class variant a stronger ability to strike from afar and pummel the enemy into submission. In addition token laser defenses have been installed and allow it to ward off any fighters or bombers that break through the frontline to harass the ship.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VIGLO,Viglo was a Sith officer that joined the Sith believing they were the future of the galaxy. He found himself stationed on Manaan in the tail end of the Jedi Civil War, a post he despised to the point he wished the Sith would just bombard the planet into a desert. Boredom led Viglo to spending most of his time at a bar on Ahto City, where he drank and womanized to his hearts content.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VILL,A clone trooper of the Grand Army of Republic and Regimental commander in the 501st legion, Vill was one of the first Clones to become a Stormtrooper of the Empire. Vill would lead his regiment to success on New Plympto against the Nosaurians and would massacre all of the resistance. Although he would unknowingly allow a Jedi, who was actually the main target, to escape during the campaign. Vill would die at the hands of Lord Vader on Bandomeer. Vader had asked if the clones were programmed to kill him without question if Palpatine commanded and Vill’s hesitation and inability to give an answer confirmed Vaders’ suspicion. Vader henceforth Force Pushed Vill off a cliff to prevent knowledge of his suspicion from reaching Palpatine.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VIPER_ALPHA,Viper Alpha was a Mandalorian Crusaders squad armed with Basilisk war droids that fought at the Battle of Ossus during the Great Sith War.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VIPSANIS,Vipsanis was the leader of a group of supposed Mandalorians who believed that he was destined to become the new Mandalore. At one point he led a fleet headed by the battlecruiser Victus to invade the lost planet Endelaan in order to prove to his followers that he was worthy of the title. His ambition blinded Vipsanis to the atrocities he was ordering his general Akero to commit, leading to doubts over his leadership.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VIXUS,They possessed seven large tentacles that were attached to a dome-shaped mouth filled with sharp teeth. An additional, pink tentacle ending with a taloned grasper was located in the vixus' maw, allowing the creature to grab its victim deep into its gullet. When at full extension, a vixus' tentacles could form a 7-meter radius.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VOCA,Voca was a Clone Commander of the 501st who eventually became a Stormtrooper Commander under Darth Vader. Voca and his command accompanied Darth Vader and Captain Shale on a mission to locate Grand Moff Tarkin's son, Garoche Tarkin. Voca and his soldiers would eventually die during this mission due to Captain Shale and Garoche Tarkin's mutual treachery; they would be ambushed and gunned down by Atoan insurgents, who were aided by the two traitors.
