TEXT_TOOLTIP_VOREN_RENSTAAL,A former Jedi trained on Ossus, Voren Renstaal fought with his master in the early Mandalorian Wars until the latter was killed in the First Battle of Onderon. This pushed Voren into joining the Revanchists, and then following Revan into the Unknown Regions. The Sith teachings which had been seeping their way into Revan's ranks since Malachor V were openly embraced by then, with Voren no exception. He adopted the title of Darth Voren, taking apprenticeship under one of Revan's Sith Knights, and was frequently stationed on Revan's flagship. Ambitious to ascend the ranks, Voren plotted to remove at least one of his superiors to hasten his ascension.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VORRU_CW,Corellian politician with criminal connections, and one of the three individuals competing for power in the Corellian sector with Garm Bel Iblis and Dupas Thomree. Became one of the first Moffs during the Clone Wars as the appointed head of Green Mantle Command.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VOSS_PARCK_CW,A Human male born on Corulag to a wealthy and prominent Corulag family with a long a proud lineage of capital ship captaincy and a tradition of naval service, Voss Parck entered the Corulag Academy to begin a career as a military officer, following in the footsteps of his father and grandfather, who had both captained capital ships. There, he trained alongside several siblings and cousins and carried on a rivalry with one cousin in particular, which would last into their military careers, though Parck generally came out behind.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VOSSK,Vossk was a leader of the Bounty Hunters Guild during the age of the Old Republic, and was a fervent believer in the honor and sanctity of its creed. He held a deep regard for its rules in dealing with bounties and fellow hunters, such as not hunting prey just to kill them or attacking fellow hunters aiming for the same target. By the time of the Dark Wars Vossk retired from the organization, growing disgusted with the new crop of mercenaries who ignored the rules of the creed, with the bounty hunter Mira being one of the few he still respected.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VOSSK_HEALTH,Health: 205 [3%/5s] (Hero)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VROOK_LAMAR,Vrook was a Jedi Master of the Dantooine Enclave. A strict man who held firmly to doctrine and the authority of the Jedi Council, he was self-admittedly critical of Jedi who failed to live up to his standards. Vrook balked at the defiance of the Revanchists who went to fight the Mandalorians against the Council's orders, and was one of the masters eager to sentence Meetra Surik into exile upon her return as punishment. In the years following the Jedi Civil War, Vrook would go into hiding from Sith assassins in the Enclave's ruins, working to restore its former glory. He would let himself be captured by mercenaries to protect the settlers of Khoonda, which led to his meeting with Surik once again on her own journey.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_VULPE,Vulpe was a General of Empress Teta and conspirator with Aleema and Satal Keto, who sought to ensure the militaries support in overthrowing the reigning government. Firmly in the pocket of the Krath, Vulpe enforced the surrender of the planets smelter foundries to the cults control.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VULPUS,A dedicated aide to Count Dooku who was one of the esteemed few to be granted a Ginivex starfighter, Vulpus was sent to observe and assist in General Grievous' experiments in turning Jedi Padawans into cyborg warriors. When it was discovered the Padawans escaped, Vulpus wished to inform Count Dooku of this failure, incurring the General's wrath. Vulpus would warn Grievous that killing him would incite Count Dooku's wrath, causing Grievous to back down. After Grievous withdrew his threat, Vulpus promised not to mention the incident to Dooku.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VULTURE_31ST,Surprisingly sturdy for Vulture Droids, the 31st Flight was specially designed to trade targeting modules for thicker, more durable hulls. Flying under the combat-experienced droid AI of DFS-1VR, these Vultures are in high demand by the Separatists' more pragmatic tactical droid models.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_VULTURE_DROID,A small droid fighter that relies on numbers and maneuverability to win dogfights. While modular enough to carry munitions, they are often replaced with extra fuel slugs to increase flight time from being minutes long. They are best used to swarm enemy fighters and bombers.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_WAMPA,Wampas were carnivorous predatory reptomammals indigenous to many remote Outer Rim Territories. The bipedal beasts stood over two meters in height with shaggy white fur constantly stained with the gore of slaughtered prey. Wampas were armed with jagged yellow teeth and deadly claws. Different subspecies of the Wampas can be found throughout the galaxy, among them are swamp wampas, jungle wampas, cliff wampas and presumably Tatooine Howlers, also known as desert wampas.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_WARGO,A Drovian member of the Black Vulkar swoop gang on Taris, Wargo was the muscle of the duo involving his buddy Frazznik. The two failed to shakedown the wanted Jedi Zayne Carrick and scoundrel Marn Hierogryph, but were tricked into a beating from a group of Wookiees instead. When the Mandalorians invaded Taris, Wargo eagerly joined them hoping to take part in a rampaging horde, but was disappointed at being forced to wear a uniform.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_WARTHOG,A clone pilot of Hunter Squadron, Warthog was highly skilled in combat operations. His squadron was often attached to the 104th Battalion, flying in support of Jedi General Plo Koon on Felucia and Kadavo. Warthog would fly behind the cockpit of various ships on space and ground as the war went on.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_WAXER,Waxer was a clone trooper who served in the 212th Attack Battalion of the Grand Army of the Republic as a member of Ghost Company. Under General Obi-Wan Kenobi, he took part in the Battle of Ryloth and the Second Battle of Geonosis with his fellow clone Boil. During the Battle of Umbara, Waxer was deceived by Pong Krell into thinking the enemy was wearing captured clone armor, and was killed in a shoot-out with the 501st.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_WHORM,Whorm Loathsom was a Kerkoiden male who hailed from the species homeworld and served both in his homeworld's planetary forces and as the general of the Retail Caucus's military forces in the Confederacy of Independent Systems. He never resigned his Planetary Forces commission, making him technically a treasonous Republic officer. An accomplished commander, his numerous victories led him to infamy throughout the Inner Core and implanted a streak of overconfidence.

Mace would be one of the most ardent defenders of the Republic, and believed only the civilisation it provided could forge peace in the galaxy.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_WLO5_TANK,The Ubrikkian WLO-5 Speeder tank was a popular choice for pirates and other factions in the Outer Rim due to their cheap price and high mobility which the driver could utilise to evade some attacks although they lacked in firepower compared to the tanks in service with the major powers. The design was also noted to be extremely easy to modify and repair which further boosted its popularity in the less wealthy areas of the galaxy.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_WOLFFE,CC-3636 was nicknamed Wolffe and was in command of Wolfpack Squad of the 104th battalion. This squad often accompanied Jedi General and Master Plo Koon in battle. Wolffe was one of the four survivors of Plo Koon’s discovery of the Malevolence. On Khorm, Wolffe both witnessed the extreme cowardice and incompetence of Ozzel, and lost an eye later in the campaign while he attempted to help Plo Koon fight Ventress. He would also be the one to spot the hidden message by Eeth Koth in a transmission by General Grievous instead of the multiple Jedi watching the transmission. Assisting Plo Koon in rescue missions for other Jedi would become a frequent occurrence for Wolffe during the Clone Wars.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_YUSANIS,The feared Echani General Yusanis was known for both his skills as a warrior and his sponsorship of Echani advancements. He had fathered five daughters to his sworn partner, yet he was in love with the Jedi Master Arren Kae. The twos tryst birthed a daughter, leading to Kae being exiled from the Order and joining the Revanchists against the Mandalorians. Yusanis left his family to fight alongside her, and he became known as a hero for his valor in the war. But Kae's death at Malachor V shattered Yusanis' spirit, causing him to retire and enter politics after the wars end.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_YUTHURA,Yuthura Ban was a Twi'lek women born on Sleheyron and enslaved to Omeesh the Hutt. Yuthura would escape enslavement after wounding the Hutt and joined up with the Jedi, but saw their hesitance to confront slavery as intolerable. She would leave the Jedi and wind up on Korriban where she joined the Sith, becoming the Academy headmaster Uthar Wynn's apprentice through her skill. Yuthura would decide which hopefuls would join the academy or not, while also fostering ambitions of replacing her master herself.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95_BOMBER,Z-95 Headhunters have many sub-models used for a variety of combat roles throughout the galaxy. Variants tuned for anti-ship and ground support are common in lower-priority task groups and local forces, adding munitions racks and mountings at a cost of flight performance.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95_GUNGAN_GLORY,A makeshift squadron of elite pilots who have found themselves in Hutt employ either by choice or in repayment of debts. Nominally under the command of the Gungan ace Piknab Carsels, they have no real loyalty to each other, but what they lack in cohesion, they make up for in greed and desperation.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95_HEADHUNTER,An extremely common and dated fighter in significant use throughout the galaxy. The current series is based on the Mark 2 which replaced the older Mark 1 interceptor and overhauled the design again. This model is armed with the standard laser cannons and missiles.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95_RAREFIED,The most elite squadron of the Virujansi Planetary Defense Force, the Rarefied Air Cavalry is comprised of the best pilots on the planet. While Garven Dreis' reputation elevates the squadron's popularity significantly, the pilots of Rarefied are just as extraordinary.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95_STAR_JEWEL_GUARD,Pilots in service to Jabba the Hutt aboard his personal yacht, Star Jewel. Flying Z-95s missile variants, the Star Jewel Guards serves as both a personal escort for the yacht and an advance guard for Jabba or his envoys landing shuttle.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95ML_HEADHUNTER,Z-95 Headhunter equipped with heavy under-wing missile boxes for long-ranged heavy missile deployment. Retains the capabilities of the base hull, turning an average fighter into an average but versatile assault craft.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_Z95XT_HEADHUNTER,Training and courier-model headhunter variation without the full combat packages of most models. Like other craft in such support roles, they are often pressed into service when nothing else is available. 
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZAALBAR,Zaalbar was the son of Wookiee Chieftain Freyyr. He was exiled from Kashyyyk after attacking his brother Chuundar with his claws in a fit or rage after learning their dealings with Czerka slavers. Zaalbar ended up on Taris and was left adrift until meeting the young Twi'lek Mission Vao. The two quickly became best friends, with Mission nicknaming him "Big Z." When Zaalbar was captured by slavers, Mission found and convinced Revan into rescuing him. Zaalbar then swore a life debt to Revan, and accompanied their journey for the Star Forge. Zaalbar's immense strength and hardy constitution make him a reliable ally on the battlefield.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZAALBAR_HEALTH,Health: 250 (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZAALBAR_MOVE,Speed: 1.3
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZAALBAR_WEAP1,1x Zaalbar's Bowcaster: 1 / 3.0s / 240m

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZAN_DANE,A mysterious pirate based on the Point Nadir Comet shadowport, Zan Dane was a flamboyant human with excellent command skills, a code of honor, and a vaguely Tapani accent. More than 400 members of his crew man his own Marauder cruiser, the corvette Amber Star, and several other ships.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZAVROS,Kalatosh Zavros was a Master of the Jedi Order who joined with the Revanchists to fight against the Mandalorians. Once a passionate believer in peace, Kalatosh turned to the dark side as did most of his fellow Revanchists following Revan's claim to the title of Dark Lord.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZHAR_LESTIN,One of the Jedi Masters of the Dantooine Enclave, Zhar Lestin took many students during his time, including Revan and Malak briefly. Zhar would try to fight off the incursion of Dorjander Kace's Mandalorian Knights from the Enclave, and was saved by the timely assistance of Zayne Carrick. During the Jedi Civil War, Zhar with Master Dorak would mold the captured Darth Revan's mind to erase his former identity, and trained Revan to use the Force again when he returned.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZHERRON,Zherron was a veteran of the Mandalorian Wars who became militia captain of Dantooine's Khoonda by the Dark Wars. He was a strict man who didn't answer to anyone save the settlements administrator Terena Adare, causing friction with local mercenaries and salvagers. While not an inspiring leader, Zherron worked hard to ensure the safety of Khoonda and its residents. After the Jedi Exile helped Khoonda fight off Exchange mercenaries, Zherron would aid the Telos Security Force against a Sith invasion.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZHERRON_HEALTH,Health: 130 (Hero)

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZIRO,Ziro Desilijic Tiure, also known as simply Ziro the Hutt, was a male oriented Hutt crime lord, a Vigo of Black Sun, and an uncle to Jabba Desilijic Tiure. The son of "Mama" the Hutt, Ziro was the brother of Jiliac, Pazda, Ebor, and Zorba Desilijic Tiure. Ziro is one of the only Hutts that have been heard to fluently speak Basic as opposed to Huttese. During the Clone Wars, Ziro arranged a deal with the Confederacy of Independent Systems in a plot to gain more power amongst the Hutt clans.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZIRO_HEALTH,Health: 195 [5%/5s] (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZIRO_MOVE,Speed: 0.8
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZIRO_WEAP1,1x Weequay Blaster Pistol: 1 / 1.5s / 220m
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZITON_MOJ,Ziton Moj was a male Falleen who worked as a Vigo for the Black Sun during the Clone Wars. He served as Captain of the Guard, however later, the Black Sun became a member of Maul's Shadow Collective after Savage Opress, Maul's brother, killed the leaders of Black Sun for refusing to join Maul's cause. Due to this, Moj became the subsequent leader of the Black Sun, and as a member of the Shadow Collective, Moj fought during the Death Watch coup on Mandalore to help further the Shadow Collective's goals.

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZOLGHAST,A Zygerrian Separatist, Zolghast commanded Separatist forces on the planet Tirahnn, sequestering himself in a secret bunker for long periods of time due to his intense paranoia. Zolghast would be captured by Republic agents seeking to disarm the planets ion cannon, but while he was being extracted a rescue attempt was performed by the Clawdite agent Braxus Lyn.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZOOM_BUTTON,Zoom into/out of selected planet
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZORBA,Zorba Desilijic Tiure was a Hutt crime lord and the leader of the Desilijic kajidic. One of few Hutts to possess hair—as a result of a genetic throwback—Zorba was the brother of Jiliac, Ebor, Ziro and Pazda, father of Jabba Desilijic Tiure, and grandfather of Rotta, Gorga and Grubba Desilijic Aarrpo. Zorba was an inept leader of Desilijic, and he had few supporters in his clan due to his outlandish schemes and financial mismanagement. During the Separatist Crisis, he was apprehended by law enforcement and sentenced to prison on the planet Kip. Jiliac took over as Desilijic leader and Jabba inherited much of Zorba's holdings.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZOZRIDOR_SLAYKE,Slayke's history prior to joining the Judicial Forces was murky even to those who served with him. Shortly before the start of the Clone Wars, the Scarlet Thranta was assigned to patrol the Sluis sector, near Separatist space. Angered by the Senate's unwillingness to act against the Separatists, Slayke went rogue, taking the Thranta and entering the Expansion Region with intentions of waging a private war against the Separatists. Other ships, including some mercenaries and civilians, soon joined the charismatic Slayke. He named this ragtag group the Sons and Daughters of Freedom, commonly referred to as Freedom's Sons.
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZOZRIDOR_SLAYKE_HEALTH,Health: 130 (Hero)
TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZOZRIDOR_SLAYKE_MOVE,Speed: 1.2

TEXT_TOOLTIP_ZUKA,Zuka was a Mandalorian who joined with Canderous Ordo's movement on Dxun. Unlike many Mandalorians, Zuka took pride in not just fighting but in maintaining and repairing weapons, finding honor in their use in battle. Canderous valued his abilities and entrusted him with the security and vehicles of their outpost. Zuka would later take part in the boarding of the Ravager during the Battle of Telos, leading a team of Mandalorians in placing proton charges within its hull.

TEXT_UNIT_FLAGSHIP_HUTTS_AAI,Irregular Long Range Raiding Task Force.

TEXT_UNIT_FLAGSHIP_HUTTS_AAT,Hutt Modernised Strike Group

TEXT_UNIT_FLAGSHIP_REPUBLIC_AAJ,Reinforced Planetary Defence Fighter Wing

TEXT_UNIT_FLAGSHIP_REPUBLIC_AAL,Corvette Wolf Pack
